summary.title: Summary
summary.description: A sample description of the service

function.title: Function/Task
function.description: The main function/task of the service

website.title: Website
website.description: Main reference website (if present) for this service. This is NOT the access point of the service

contact.title: Contact Team
contact.description: Main contacts (single person or team) for this service

list.title: I/O Flows list
list.description: This section describes prominent I/O flows (operations) offered by your service. Each input/output pair for a given flow can be described via media type (also known as a Multipurpose Internet Mail Extensions - or MIME type) indicating the nature and format of a document, file, or assortment of bytes. MIME types are defined and standardized in IETF's RFC 6838 - see https://www.iana.org/assignments/media-types/media-types.xhtml

input.title: Input
input.description: Input MIME types. You can add one or more input types related to this flow. An empty list means no input is required for this operation.

output.title: Output
output.description: Output MIME types. You can add one or more output types related to this flow. An empty list means there is no output for this operation.

description.title: Description
description.description: A brief description for this I/O flow

usercontrol.title: Controlled by user
usercontrol.description: This I/O flow requires user control via graphical user interface (GUI)

instances.title: Instances
instances.description: list of 1 or more urls representing main access points. When more than 1 elements are present, first entry is considered the main access point

oas.title: OpenAPI specification
oas.description: URL to OpenAPI definition (JSON/YAML) describing REST API for this service. OAS URL must be publicly accessible

horizontal.title: Horizontal service
horizontal.description: The service is potentially useful for all researchers, no matter their affiliation nor scientific discipline. Usually provided by computing centers and e-Infrastructures, offering additional value to service providers and developers, who want to enhance their services with new capabilities like computing or storage

gui.title: Graphical User Interface
gui.description: The service provides a GUI to control I/O processes (conversion parameters, etc.)

presentation.title: Presentation layer
presentation.description: The service offers a presentation layer to inspect data (e.g.: images, 3D models, etc.)

trl.title: Technology Readiness Level (TRL)
trl.description: Technology Readiness Levels (TRL) are a type of measurement system used to assess the maturity level of a particular technology. Each service is evaluated against the parameters for each technology level and is then assigned a TRL rating based on the projects progress. Please refer to H2IOSC WP3 documentation.

srl.title: Societal Readiness Level (SRL)
srl.description: Societal Readiness Level (SRL) is a way of assessing the level of societal adaptation of a service to be integrated into society. The readiness of the society to adopt this specific service. Please refer to H2IOSC WP3 documentation.

orl.title: Organizational Readiness Level (ORL)
orl.description: Organizational Readiness Level (ORL) is mainly about the domestication of technology, in this case the organisational impact of a certain service. Please refer to H2IOSC WP3 documentation.

lrl.title: Legal Readiness Level (LRL)
lrl.description: Legal Readiness Level (LRL) is related to legal and regulatory implications of innovations associated with this specific service. Please refer to H2IOSC WP3 documentation.

repositories.title: Repositories
repositories.description: A list of one or more repositories (e.g.: github, gitlab, etc.) - if available - with reference code used to realize the service
